channel.title: Movies
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: When the Office Holiday Party Goes Oh So Wrong, Onscreen
item.description: Work celebrations are a tradition in Hollywood. With “Office Christmas Party” coming out, here are some other film and TV bashes.
item.author: By MARC SPITZ

item.title: Searching for Lady Kung Fu
item.description: Angela Mao was as famous as Bruce Lee when she was a martial arts film star during the 1970s. Then she seemed to vanish. It turns out she’s been in Queens this whole time.
item.author: By ALEX VADUKUL

item.title: A Boy Raised by a Few ‘20th Century Women’
item.description: In Mike Mills’s autobiographical film, Annette Bening and Greta Gerwig portray two strong influences in his upbringing.
item.author: By JULIE BLOOM

item.title: Casey Affleck Is Making Another Splash, Reluctantly
item.description: Mr. Affleck, uncomfortable in the spotlight, still turns in a performance in “Manchester by the Sea” that is likely to get him noticed, darn it.
item.author: By CARA BUCKLEY

item.title: L.A. Transcendental: How ‘La La Land’ Chases the Sublime
item.description: Damien Chazelle discusses how he created the look, sound and texture of his latest film, which stars Emma Stone, Ryan Gosling and, yes, Los Angeles.
item.author: By MEKADO MURPHY

item.title: Hollywood Holiday Habits: Big Games, Small Gifts and Other Joys
item.description: Gabrielle Union and Matthew McConaughey are among those who share their seasonal memories, on and offscreen.
item.author: By KATHRYN SHATTUCK

item.title: How the First ‘Bad Santa’ Boozed Down the Chimney
item.description: The making of the holiday perennial took many cooks and some creative differences on set. Ahead of “Bad Santa 2,” an oral history of the original.
item.author: By BRUCE FRETTS

item.title: Miriam Weinstein, Mother and Backbone of Original Miramax, Dies at 90
item.description: Ms. Weinstein had no plans to stop contributing (advice or pastries), even after Miramax grew in fame and value.
item.author: By ANITA GATES

item.title: Movie Listings for Nov. 4-10
item.description: A guide to movies playing at theaters in the New York City area, as well as select festivals and film series.
